section: The Joint Venturers recognize that both of the Joint Venturers are and will continue to be engaged in the conduct of their respective businesses for their own account. Neither Participant shall be entitled to compensation for services rendered to the Joint Venture as such, but each Investor shall be reimbursed for all direct expenses, including travel, office, and all other out-of-pocket expenses incurred in the operation of the affairs of the Joint Venture and the promotion of its businesses. It is agreed that either Joint Venturer shall, except as provided for below, have authority to execute instruments of any character relating to the affairs of the Joint Venture; provided, that without the written consent or approval of both of the Joint Venturers: (i) the Joint Venture shall incur no liability of any sort, nor any indebtedness for borrowed funds; (ii) no assets owned in the name of the Joint Venture be disposed of; and (iii) no commitment to purchase any item for the Joint Venture shall be made.
explanation: This section grants each Joint Venturer the authority to execute instruments related to the Joint Venture's affairs. However, it simultaneously restricts their ability to incur liability, dispose of assets, or make purchase commitments without the consent of both Joint Venturers. This creates a contradiction. The initial clause implies broad authority, while the subsequent clauses significantly limit that authority, making it unclear what actions a single Joint Venturer can independently take. The use of 'except as provided for below' suggests that the limitations are exceptions to a general rule, but the limitations are so broad they almost negate the initial grant of authority.

section: The Founders shall maintain adequate books and records to be kept of all the Joint Venture activities and affairs conducted pursuant to the terms of this Agreement. All direct costs and expenses, which shall include any insurance costs in connection with the distribution of the Goods or operations of the Partnership, or if the business of the Syndicate requires additional office facilities than those now presently maintained by each Owner, such item shall be paid by the Joint Venture.
explanation: This section begins by referring to the Joint Venturers as 'Founders,' which is a term not previously defined in the agreement. Later, it mentions 'Partnership' and 'Syndicate,' which are also undefined and inconsistent with the stated intention of forming a Joint Venture, not a partnership or syndicate. This creates confusion as to the legal structure and parties involved. These misaligned terms lead to confusion about the roles and responsibilities.

section: The Joint Venturers agree and declare that this association for the carrying on of a joint venture business operation does not, and is not intended to create a partnership, for either legal or United States income tax purposes, each Party recognizing that the other is willing and able to contribute capital, labor, and services for the operation of a successful joint venture business. Further, each Party elects under the authority of Section 761(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (the "Code"), as amended and all successor statutes, to be excluded from the application of all of the provisions of Subchapter K of Chapter 1 of the Subtitle A of the Code, and the Parties agree that the election out of Subchapter K of Chapter 1 of Subtitle A of the Code shall, if necessary, be manifested by their execution and filing of all appropriate documentation.
explanation: While the section aims to explicitly avoid partnership classification for tax purposes by electing out of Subchapter K of the Internal Revenue Code, the language used can be ambiguous. The phrase 'if necessary' regarding the execution and filing of documentation suggests uncertainty about whether the election is truly being made. This creates a potential ambiguity about the tax treatment of the Joint Venture and whether the necessary steps are actually being taken to ensure it is treated as something other than a partnership for tax purposes.
